paper_abstract: Avoiding gouge is crucial when converting cutter contact (CC) data into cutter location (CL) data for arbitrary pockets involving islands. This investigation presents a dynamic method for eliminating global gouges. Moreover, this study proposes using pair-wise bridges to merge pockets and islands. The proposed pair-wise bridge method leaves very small sized scallops. Additionally, an alternative Boolean method is designed to solve the problem of pocket containing numerous islands.
paper_title: Tool path generation for arbitrary pockets with islands
